1.verse: The Beginning - In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.

2.verse: The earth didn’t have any shape. And it was empty. There was darkness over the surface of the waves. At that time, the Spirit of God was hovering over the waters.

3.verse: God said, “Let there be light.” And there was light.

4.verse: God saw that the light was good. He separated the light from the darkness.

5.verse: God called the light “day.” He called the darkness “night.” There was evening, and there was morning. It was day one.

6.verse: God said, “Let there be a huge space between the waters. Let it separate water from water.”

7.verse: And that’s exactly what happened. God made the huge space between the waters. He separated the water under the space from the water above it.

8.verse: God called the huge space “sky.” There was evening, and there was morning. It was day two.

9.verse: God said, “Let the water under the sky be gathered into one place. Let dry ground appear.” And that’s exactly what happened.

10.verse: God called the dry ground “land.” He called all the water that was gathered together “seas.” And God saw that it was good.

11.verse: Then God said, “Let the land produce plants. Let them produce their own seeds. And let there be trees on the land that grow fruit with seeds in it. Let each kind of plant or tree have its own kind of seeds.” And that’s exactly what happened.

12.verse: So the land produced plants. Each kind of plant had its own kind of seeds. And the land produced trees that grew fruit with seeds in it. Each kind of tree had its own kind of seeds. God saw that it was good.

13.verse: There was evening, and there was morning. It was day three.

14.verse: God said, “Let there be lights in the huge space of the sky. Let them separate the day from the night. Let the lights set the times for the holy celebrations and the days and the years.

15.verse: Let them be lights in the huge space of the sky to give light on the earth.” And that’s exactly what happened.

16.verse: God made two great lights. He made the larger light to rule over the day and the smaller light to rule over the night. He also made the stars.

17.verse: God put the lights in the huge space of the sky to give light on the earth.

18.verse: He put them there to rule over the day and the night. He put them there to separate light from darkness. God saw that it was good.

19.verse: There was evening, and there was morning. It was day four.

20.verse: God said, “Let the seas be filled with living things. Let birds fly above the earth across the huge space of the sky.”

21.verse: So God created the great sea creatures. He created every kind of living thing that fills the seas and moves about in them. He created every kind of bird that flies. And God saw that it was good.

22.verse: God blessed them. He said, “Have little ones so that there will be many of you. Fill the water in the seas. Let there be more and more birds on the earth.”

23.verse: There was evening, and there was morning. It was day five.

24.verse: God said, “Let the land produce every kind of living creature. Let there be livestock, and creatures that move along the ground, and wild animals.” And that’s exactly what happened.

25.verse: God made every kind of wild animal. He made every kind of livestock. He made every kind of creature that moves along the ground. And God saw that it was good.

26.verse: Then God said, “Let us make human beings so that they are like us. Let them rule over the fish in the seas and the birds in the sky. Let them rule over the livestock and all the wild animals. And let them rule over all the creatures that move along the ground.”

27.verse: So God created human beings in his own likeness. He created them to be like himself. He created them as male and female.

28.verse: God blessed them. He said to them, “Have children so that there will be many of you. Fill the earth and bring it under your control. Rule over the fish in the seas and the birds in the sky. Rule over every living creature that moves along the ground.”

29.verse: Then God said, “I am giving you every plant on the face of the whole earth that produces its own seeds. I am giving you every tree that has fruit with seeds in it. All of them will be given to you for food.

30.verse: I am giving every green plant as food for all the land animals and for all the birds in the sky. I am also giving the plants to all the creatures that move along the ground. I am giving them to every living thing that breathes.” And that’s exactly what happened.

31.verse: God saw everything he had made. And it was very good. There was evening, and there was morning. It was day six.

1.verse: So the heavens and the earth and everything in them were completed.

2.verse: By the seventh day God had finished the work he had been doing. So on that day he rested from all his work.

3.verse: God blessed the seventh day and made it holy. He blessed it because on that day he rested from all the work he had done.

4.verse: Adam and Eve - Here is the story of the heavens and the earth when they were created. The LORD God made the earth and the heavens.

5.verse: At that time, bushes had not yet appeared on the earth. Plants had not started to grow. The LORD God had not sent rain on the earth. And there was no one to farm the land.

6.verse: But streams came from the earth. They watered the entire surface of the ground.

7.verse: Then the LORD God formed a man. He made him out of the dust of the ground. God breathed the breath of life into him. And the man became a living person.

8.verse: The LORD God had planted a garden in the east in Eden. He put in the garden the man he had formed.

9.verse: The LORD God made every kind of tree grow out of the ground. The trees were pleasing to look at. Their fruit was good to eat. There were two trees in the middle of the garden. One of them had fruit that let people live forever. The other had fruit that let people tell the difference between good and evil.

10.verse: A river watered the garden. It flowed out of Eden. From there the river separated into four other rivers.

11.verse: The name of the first river is the Pishon. It winds through the whole land of Havilah. Gold is found there.

12.verse: The gold of that land is good. Onyx and sweet-smelling resin are also found there.

13.verse: The name of the second river is the Gihon. It winds through the whole land of Cush.

14.verse: The name of the third river is the Tigris. It runs along the east side of Ashur. And the fourth river is called the Euphrates.

15.verse: The LORD God put the man in the Garden of Eden. He put him there to farm its land and take care of it.

16.verse: The LORD God gave the man a command. He said, “You may eat fruit from any tree in the garden.

17.verse: But you must not eat the fruit from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil. If you do, you will certainly die.”

18.verse: The LORD God said, “It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make a helper who is just right for him.”

19.verse: The LORD God had formed all the wild animals and all the birds in the sky. He had made all of them out of the ground. He brought them to the man to see what names he would give them. And the name the man gave each living creature became its name.

20.verse: So the man gave names to all the livestock, all the birds in the sky, and all the wild animals. But Adam didn’t find a helper that was just right for him.

21.verse: So the LORD God caused him to fall into a deep sleep. While the man was sleeping, the LORD God took out one of the man’s ribs. Then the LORD God closed the opening in the man’s side.

22.verse: Then the LORD God made a woman. He made her from the rib he had taken out of the man. And the LORD God brought her to the man.

23.verse: The man said, “Her bones have come from my bones. Her body has come from my body. She will be named ‘woman,’ because she was taken out of a man.”

24.verse: That’s why a man leaves his father and mother and is joined to his wife. The two of them become one.

25.verse: Adam and his wife were both naked. They didn’t feel any shame.

1.verse: Adam and Eve Fall Into Sin - The serpent was more clever than any of the wild animals the LORD God had made. The serpent said to the woman, “Did God really say, ‘You must not eat fruit from any tree in the garden’?”

2.verse: The woman said to the serpent, “We may eat fruit from the trees in the garden.

3.verse: But God did say, ‘You must not eat the fruit from the tree in the middle of the garden. Do not even touch it. If you do, you will die.’ ”

4.verse: “You will certainly not die,” the serpent said to the woman.

5.verse: “God knows that when you eat fruit from that tree, you will know things you have never known before. Like God, you will be able to tell the difference between good and evil.”

6.verse: The woman saw that the tree’s fruit was good to eat and pleasing to look at. She also saw that it would make a person wise. So she took some of the fruit and ate it. She also gave some to her husband, who was with her. And he ate it.

7.verse: Then both of them knew things they had never known before. They realized they were naked. So they sewed together fig leaves and made clothes for themselves.

8.verse: Then the man and his wife heard the LORD God walking in the garden. It was during the coolest time of the day. They hid from the LORD God among the trees of the garden.

9.verse: But the LORD God called out to the man. “Where are you?” he asked.

10.verse: “I heard you in the garden,” the man answered. “I was afraid, because I was naked. So I hid.”

11.verse: The LORD God said, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten fruit from the tree I commanded you not to eat from?”

12.verse: The man said, “It’s the fault of the woman you put here with me. She gave me some fruit from the tree. And I ate it.”

13.verse: Then the LORD God said to the woman, “What have you done?” The woman said, “The serpent tricked me. That’s why I ate the fruit.”

14.verse: So the LORD God spoke to the serpent. He said, “Because you have done this, “You are set apart from all livestock and all wild animals. I am putting a curse on you. You will crawl on your belly. You will eat dust all the days of your life.

15.verse: I will make you and the woman hate each other. Your children and her children will be enemies. Her son will crush your head. And you will bite his heel.”

16.verse: The LORD God said to the woman, “I will increase your pain when you give birth. You will be in great pain when you have children. You will long for your husband. And he will rule over you.”

17.verse: The LORD God said to Adam, “You listened to your wife’s suggestion. You ate fruit from the tree I warned you about. I said, ‘You must not eat its fruit.’ “So I am putting a curse on the ground because of what you did. All the days of your life you will have to work hard. It will be painful for you to get food from the ground.

18.verse: You will eat plants from the field, even though the ground produces thorns and prickly weeds.

19.verse: You will have to work hard and sweat a lot to produce the food you eat. You were made out of the ground. You will return to it when you die. You are dust, and you will return to dust.”

20.verse: Adam named his wife Eve. She would become the mother of every living person.

21.verse: The LORD God made clothes out of animal skins for Adam and his wife to wear.

22.verse: The LORD God said, “Just like one of us, the man can now tell the difference between good and evil. He must not be allowed to reach out and pick fruit from the tree of life and eat it. If he does, he will live forever.”

23.verse: So the LORD God drove the man out of the Garden of Eden. He sent the man to farm the ground he had been made from.

24.verse: The LORD God drove him out and then placed angels on the east side of the garden. He also placed there a flaming sword that flashed back and forth. The angels and the sword guarded the way to the tree of life.

1.verse: Cain and Abel - Adam loved his wife Eve and slept with her. She became pregnant and gave birth to Cain. She said, “With the LORD’s help I have had a baby boy.”

2.verse: Later she gave birth to his brother Abel. Abel took care of sheep. Cain farmed the land.

3.verse: After some time, Cain gathered some things he had grown. He brought them as an offering to the LORD.

4.verse: And Abel also brought an offering. He brought the fattest parts of some animals from his flock. They were the first animals born to their mothers. The LORD was pleased with Abel and his offering.

5.verse: But he wasn’t pleased with Cain and his offering. So Cain became very angry, and his face was sad.

6.verse: Then the LORD said to Cain, “Why are you angry? Why are you looking so sad?

7.verse: Do what is right and then you will be accepted. If you don’t do what is right, sin is waiting at your door to grab you. It desires to control you. But you must rule over it.”

8.verse: Cain said to his brother Abel, “Let’s go out to the field.” So they went out. There Cain attacked his brother Abel and killed him.

9.verse: Then the LORD said to Cain, “Where is your brother Abel?” “I don’t know,” Cain replied. “Am I supposed to take care of my brother?”

10.verse: The LORD said, “What have you done? Listen! Your brother’s blood is crying out to me from the ground.

11.verse: So I am putting a curse on you. I am driving you away from this ground. It has opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.

12.verse: When you farm the land, it will not produce its crops for you anymore. You will be a restless person who wanders around on the earth.”

13.verse: Cain said to the LORD, “You are punishing me more than I can take.

14.verse: Today you are driving me away from the land. I will be hidden from you. I’ll be a restless person who wanders around on the earth. Anyone who finds me will kill me.”

15.verse: But the LORD said to him, “No. Anyone who kills you will be paid back seven times.” The LORD put a mark on Cain. Then anyone who found him wouldn’t kill him.

16.verse: So Cain went away from the LORD. He lived in the land of Nod. It was east of Eden.

17.verse: Cain loved his wife and slept with her. She became pregnant and gave birth to Enoch. At that time Cain was building a city. He named it after his son Enoch.

18.verse: Enoch had a son named Irad. Irad was the father of Mehujael. Mehujael was the father of Methushael. And Methushael was the father of Lamech.

19.verse: Lamech married two women. One was named Adah, and the other was named Zillah.

20.verse: Adah gave birth to Jabal. He was the father of people who live in tents and raise livestock.

21.verse: His brother’s name was Jubal. He was the father of everyone who plays stringed instruments and wind instruments.

22.verse: Zillah also had a son. His name was Tubal-Cain. He made all kinds of tools out of bronze and iron. Tubal-Cain’s sister was Naamah.

23.verse: Lamech said to his wives, “Adah and Zillah, listen to me! You wives of Lamech, hear my words! I have killed a man because he wounded me. I have killed a young man because he hurt me.

24.verse: Anyone who would have killed Cain would have been paid back seven times. But anyone who hurts me will be paid back 77 times.”

25.verse: Adam slept with his wife again. She gave birth to a son and named him Seth. She said, “God has given me another child. He will take the place of Abel, because Cain killed him.”

26.verse: Seth also had a son and named him Enosh. Then people began to call on the name of the LORD.

1.verse: The Family Line of Adam - Here is the written story of Adam’s family line. When God created human beings, he made them to be like him.

2.verse: He created them as male and female, and he blessed them. He called them “human beings” when they were created.

3.verse: When Adam was 130 years old, he had a son who was like him. He named him Seth.

4.verse: Adam lived 800 years after Seth was born. He also had other sons and daughters.

5.verse: Adam lived a total of 930 years. And then he died.

6.verse: Seth lived 105 years. Then he became the father of Enosh.

7.verse: Seth lived 807 years after Enosh was born. He also had other sons and daughters.

8.verse: Seth lived a total of 912 years. And then he died.

9.verse: Enosh lived 90 years. Then he became the father of Kenan.

10.verse: Enosh lived 815 years after Kenan was born. He also had other sons and daughters.

11.verse: Enosh lived a total of 905 years. And then he died.

12.verse: Kenan lived 70 years. Then he became the father of Mahalalel.

13.verse: Kenan lived 840 years after Mahalalel was born. He also had other sons and daughters.

14.verse: Kenan lived a total of 910 years. And then he died.

15.verse: Mahalalel lived 65 years. Then he became the father of Jared.

16.verse: Mahalalel lived 830 years after Jared was born. He also had other sons and daughters.

17.verse: Mahalalel lived a total of 895 years. And then he died.

18.verse: Jared lived 162 years. Then he became the father of Enoch.

19.verse: Jared lived 800 years after Enoch was born. He also had other sons and daughters.

20.verse: Jared lived a total of 962 years. And then he died.

21.verse: Enoch lived 65 years. Then he became the father of Methuselah.

22.verse: Enoch walked faithfully with God 300 years after Methuselah was born. He also had other sons and daughters.

23.verse: Enoch lived a total of 365 years.

24.verse: Enoch walked faithfully with God. And then he couldn’t be found, because God took him from this life.

25.verse: Methuselah lived 187 years. Then he became the father of Lamech.

26.verse: Methuselah lived 782 years after Lamech was born. He also had other sons and daughters.

27.verse: Methuselah lived a total of 969 years. And then he died.

28.verse: Lamech lived 182 years. Then he had a son

29.verse: and named him Noah. Lamech said, “He will comfort us when we are working. He’ll comfort us when our hands work so hard they hurt. We have to work hard because the LORD put a curse on the ground.”

30.verse: Lamech lived 595 years after Noah was born. He also had other sons and daughters.

31.verse: Lamech lived a total of 777 years. And then he died.

32.verse: After Noah was 500 years old, he became the father of Shem, Ham and Japheth.

1.verse: The Sins of Everyone on Earth - There began to be many human beings on the earth. And daughters were born to them.

2.verse: The sons of God saw that the daughters of human beings were beautiful. So they married any of them they chose.

3.verse: Then the LORD said, “My Spirit will not struggle with human beings forever. They will have only 120 years to live.”

4.verse: The Nephilim were on the earth in those days. That was when the sons of God went to the daughters of human beings. Children were born to them. The Nephilim were famous heroes who lived long ago. Nephilim were also on the earth later on.

5.verse: The LORD saw how bad the sins of everyone on earth had become. They only thought about evil things.

6.verse: The LORD was very sad that he had made human beings on the earth. His heart was filled with pain.

7.verse: So the LORD said, “I created human beings, but I will wipe them out. I will also destroy the animals, the birds in the sky, and the creatures that move along the ground. I am very sad that I have made human beings.”

8.verse: But the LORD was very pleased with Noah.

9.verse: Noah and the Flood - Here is the story of Noah’s family line. Noah was a godly man. He was without blame among the people of his time. He walked faithfully with God.

10.verse: Noah had three sons. Their names were Shem, Ham and Japheth.

11.verse: The earth was very sinful in God’s eyes. It was full of people who did mean and harmful things.

12.verse: God saw how sinful the earth had become. All its people were living very sinful lives.

13.verse: So God said to Noah, “I am going to put an end to everyone. They have filled the earth with their harmful acts. I am certainly going to destroy them and the earth.

14.verse: So make yourself an ark out of cypress wood. Make rooms in it. Cover it with tar inside and out.

15.verse: Here is how I want you to build it. The ark has to be 450 feet long. It has to be 75 feet wide and 45 feet high.

16.verse: Make a roof for it. Leave below the roof an opening all the way around that is a foot and a half high. Put a door in one side of the ark. Make lower, middle and upper decks.

17.verse: I am going to bring a flood on the earth. It will destroy all life under the sky. It will destroy every living creature that breathes. Everything on earth will die.

18.verse: But I will make my covenant with you. You will go into the ark. Your sons and your wife and your sons’ wives will enter it with you.

19.verse: Bring a male and a female of every living thing into the ark. They will be kept alive with you.

20.verse: Two of every kind of bird will come to you. Two of every kind of animal will also come to you. And so will two of every kind of creature that moves along the ground. All of them will be kept alive with you.

21.verse: Take every kind of food that you will need. Store it away as food for you and them.”

22.verse: Noah did everything just as God commanded him.

1.verse: Then the LORD said to Noah, “Go into the ark with your whole family. I know that you are a godly man among the people of today.

2.verse: Take seven pairs of every kind of ‘clean’ animal with you. Take a male and a female of each kind. Take one pair of every kind of animal that is not ‘clean.’ Take a male and a female of each kind.

3.verse: Also take seven pairs of every kind of bird. Take a male and a female of each kind. Then every kind will be kept alive. They can spread out again over the whole earth.

4.verse: Seven days from now I will send rain on the earth. It will rain for 40 days and 40 nights. I will destroy from the face of the earth every living creature I have made.”

5.verse: Noah did everything the LORD commanded him to do.

6.verse: Noah was 600 years old when the flood came on the earth.

7.verse: He and his sons entered the ark. His wife and his sons’ wives went with them. They entered the ark to escape the waters of the flood.

8.verse: Male and female pairs of “clean” animals and pairs of animals that were not “clean” came to Noah. So did male and female pairs of birds and of all the creatures that move along the ground.

9.verse: All of them came to Noah and entered the ark. Everything happened just as God had commanded Noah.

10.verse: After seven days the flood came on the earth.

11.verse: Noah was 600 years old. It was the 17th day of the second month of the year. On that day all of the springs at the bottom of the oceans burst open. God opened the windows of the sky.

12.verse: Rain fell on the earth for 40 days and 40 nights.

13.verse: On that same day Noah entered the ark together with his sons Shem, Ham and Japheth. Noah’s wife and the wives of his three sons also entered it.

14.verse: They had every kind of wild animal with them. They had every kind of livestock, creature that moves along the ground, and bird that flies.

15.verse: Pairs of all living creatures that breathe came to Noah and entered the ark.

16.verse: The animals going in were male and female of every living thing. Everything happened just as God had commanded Noah. Then the LORD shut him in.

17.verse: For 40 days the flood kept coming on the earth. As the waters rose higher, they lifted the ark high above the earth.

18.verse: The waters rose higher and higher on the earth. And the ark floated on the water.

19.verse: The waters rose on the earth until all the high mountains under the entire sky were covered.

20.verse: The waters continued to rise until they covered the mountains by more than 20 feet.

21.verse: Every living thing that moved on land died. The birds, the livestock and the wild animals died. All of the creatures that fill the earth also died. And so did every human being.

22.verse: Every breathing thing on dry land died.

23.verse: Every living thing on earth was wiped out. People and animals were destroyed. The creatures that move along the ground and the birds in the sky were wiped out. Everything on earth was destroyed. Only Noah and those with him in the ark were left.

24.verse: The waters flooded the earth for 150 days.

1.verse: But God showed concern for Noah. He also showed concern for all the wild animals and livestock that were with Noah in the ark. So God sent a wind to sweep over the earth. And the waters began to go down.

2.verse: The springs at the bottom of the oceans had been closed. The windows of the sky had also been closed. And the rain had stopped falling from the sky.

3.verse: The water on the earth continued to go down. At the end of the 150 days the water had gone down.

4.verse: On the 17th day of the seventh month, the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.

5.verse: The waters continued to go down until the tenth month. On the first day of that month, the tops of the mountains could be seen.

6.verse: After 40 days Noah opened a window he had made in the ark.

7.verse: He sent out a raven. It kept flying back and forth until the water on the earth had dried up.

8.verse: Then Noah sent out a dove. He wanted to see if the water on the surface of the ground had gone down.

9.verse: But the dove couldn’t find any place to rest. Water still covered the whole surface of the earth. So the dove returned to Noah in the ark. Noah reached out his hand and took the dove in. He brought it back to himself in the ark.

10.verse: He waited seven more days. Then he sent out the dove again from the ark.

11.verse: In the evening the dove returned to him. There in its beak was a freshly picked olive leaf! So Noah knew that the water on the earth had gone down.

12.verse: He waited seven more days. Then he sent out the dove again. But this time it didn’t return to him.

13.verse: It was the first day of the first month of Noah’s 601st year. The water on the earth had dried up. Then Noah removed the covering from the ark. He saw that the surface of the ground was dry.

14.verse: By the 27th day of the second month the earth was completely dry.

15.verse: Then God said to Noah,

16.verse: “Come out of the ark. Bring your wife and your sons and their wives with you.

17.verse: Bring out every kind of living thing that is with you. Bring the birds, the animals, and all the creatures that move along the ground. Then they can multiply on the earth. They can have little ones and the number of them can increase.”

18.verse: So Noah came out of the ark. His sons and his wife and his sons’ wives were with him.

19.verse: All the animals came out of the ark. The creatures that move along the ground also came out. So did all the birds. Everything that moves on land came out of the ark, one kind after another.

20.verse: Then Noah built an altar to honor the LORD. He took some of the “clean” animals and birds. He sacrificed them on the altar as burnt offerings.

21.verse: The smell of the offerings pleased the LORD. He said to himself, “I will never put a curse on the ground again because of human beings. I will not do it even though their hearts are always directed toward evil. Their thoughts are evil from the time they are young. I will never destroy all living things again, as I have just done.

22.verse: “As long as the earth lasts, there will always be a time to plant and a time to gather the crops. As long as the earth lasts, there will always be cold and heat. There will always be summer and winter, day and night.”

1.verse: God Makes a Covenant With Noah - Then God blessed Noah and his sons. He said to them, “Have children so that there are many of you. Fill the earth.

2.verse: All the land animals will be afraid of you. All the birds in the sky will be afraid of you. Every creature that moves along the ground will be afraid of you. So will every fish in the seas. Every living thing is put under your control.

3.verse: Everything that lives and moves about will be food for you. I have already given you the green plants for food. Now I am giving you everything.

4.verse: “But you must not eat meat that still has blood in it.

5.verse: I will certainly hold someone accountable if you are murdered. I will even hold animals accountable if they kill you. I will also hold anyone accountable who murders another person.

6.verse: “Anyone who murders a human being will be killed by a human being. That is because I have made human beings so that they are like me.

7.verse: “Have children so that there will be many of you. Multiply and become many on the earth.”

8.verse: Then God spoke to Noah and to his sons who were with him. He said,

9.verse: “I am now making my covenant with you and with all your children who will be born after you.

10.verse: I am making it also with every living creature that was with you in the ark. I am making my covenant with the birds, the livestock and all the wild animals. I am making it with all the creatures that came out of the ark with you. In fact, I am making it with every living thing on earth.

11.verse: Here is my covenant I am making with you. The waters of a flood will never again destroy all life. A flood will never again destroy the earth.”

12.verse: God continued, “My covenant is between me and you and every living creature with you. It is a covenant for all time to come. Here is the sign of the covenant I am making.

13.verse: I have put my rainbow in the clouds. It will be the sign of the covenant between me and the earth.

14.verse: Sometimes when I bring clouds over the earth, a rainbow will appear in them.

15.verse: Then I will remember my covenant between me and you and every kind of living creature. The waters will never again become a flood to destroy all life.

16.verse: When the rainbow appears in the clouds, I will see it. I will remember that my covenant will last forever. It is a covenant between me and every kind of living creature on earth.”

17.verse: So God said to Noah, “The rainbow is the sign of my covenant. I have made my covenant between me and all life on earth.”

18.verse: The Sons of Noah - The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham and Japheth. Ham was the father of Canaan.

19.verse: The people who were scattered over the earth came from Noah’s three sons.

20.verse: Noah was a man who farmed the land. He decided to plant a field that produced grapes for making wine.

21.verse: When he drank some of the wine, it made him drunk. Then he lay down inside his tent without any clothes on.

22.verse: Ham saw his father naked. Then Ham, the father of Canaan, went outside and told his two brothers.

23.verse: But Shem and Japheth picked up a piece of clothing and laid it across their shoulders. Then they walked backward into the tent. They covered their father’s body. They turned their faces away because they didn’t want to see their father naked.

24.verse: Then Noah woke up from his sleep that was caused by the wine. He found out what his youngest son had done to him.

25.verse: He said, “May a curse be put on Canaan! He will be the lowest of slaves to his brothers.”

26.verse: Noah also said, “May the LORD, the God of Shem, be praised. May Canaan be the slave of Shem.

27.verse: May God add land to Japheth’s territory. May Japheth live in the tents of Shem. And may Canaan be the slave of Japheth.”

28.verse: After the flood Noah lived 350 years.

29.verse: Noah lived a total of 950 years. And then he died.

1.verse: A List of Nations - Here is the story of Shem, Ham and Japheth. They were Noah’s sons. After the flood, they also had sons.

2.verse: The Sons of Japheth The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek and Tiras.

3.verse: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.

4.verse: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites and the Rodanites.

5.verse: From these people came the families who lived near the Mediterranean Sea. Each tribe and nation then spread out into its own territory and had its own language.

6.verse: The Sons of Ham The sons of Ham were Cush, Egypt, Put and Canaan.

7.verse: The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah and Sabteka. The sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.

8.verse: Cush was the father of Nimrod. Nimrod became a mighty hero on the earth.

9.verse: He was a mighty hunter in the LORD’s eyes. That’s why people sometimes compare others with Nimrod. They say, “They are like Nimrod, who was a mighty hunter in the LORD’s eyes.”

10.verse: The first capital cities of Nimrod’s kingdom were Babylon, Uruk, Akkad and Kalneh. These cities were in the land of Babylon.

11.verse: From that land he went to Assyria. There he built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir and Calah.

12.verse: He also built Resen, which is between Nineveh and Calah. Nineveh is the most famous city.

13.verse: Egypt was the father of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,

14.verse: Pathrusites, Kasluhites and Caphtorites. The Philistines came from the Kasluhites.

15.verse: Canaan was the father of Sidon. Sidon was his oldest son. Canaan was also the father of the Hittites,

16.verse: Jebusites, Amorites and Girgashites.

17.verse: And he was the father of the Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,

18.verse: Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites. Later the Canaanite tribes scattered.

19.verse: The borders of Canaan reached from Sidon toward Gerar all the way to Gaza. Then they continued toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboyim all the way to Lasha.

20.verse: These are the sons of Ham. They are listed by their tribes and languages in their territories and nations.

21.verse: The Sons of Shem Sons were also born to Shem, Japheth’s younger brother. All the sons of Eber belonged to Shem’s family line.

22.verse: The sons of Shem were Elam, Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram.

23.verse: The sons of Aram were Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshek.

24.verse: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah. Shelah was the father of Eber.

25.verse: Eber had two sons. One was named Peleg. That’s because the earth was divided up in his time. His brother was named Joktan.

26.verse: Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

27.verse: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

28.verse: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

29.verse: Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. They were all sons of Joktan.

30.verse: The area where they lived stretched from Mesha toward Sephar. It was in the eastern hill country.

31.verse: These are the sons of Shem. They are listed by their tribes and languages in their territories and nations.

32.verse: These are the tribes of Noah’s sons. They are listed by their family lines within their nations. From them the nations spread out over the earth after the flood.

1.verse: The Tower of Babel - The whole world had only one language, and everyone spoke it.

2.verse: They moved to the east and found a broad valley in Babylon. There they made their home.

3.verse: They said to one another, “Come on! Let’s make bricks and bake them well.” They used bricks instead of stones. They used tar to hold the bricks together.

4.verse: Then they said, “Come on! Let’s build a city for ourselves. Let’s build a tower that reaches to the sky. We’ll make a name for ourselves. Then we won’t be scattered over the whole earth.”

5.verse: But the LORD came down to see the city and the tower the people were building.

6.verse: He said, “All these people are united and speak the same language. That is why they can do all this. Now they will be able to do anything they plan.

7.verse: Come on! Let us go down and mix up their language. Then they will not be able to understand one other.”

8.verse: So the LORD scattered them from there over the whole earth. And they stopped building the city.

9.verse: There the LORD mixed up the language of the whole world. That’s why the city was called Babel. From there the LORD scattered them over the whole earth.

10.verse: The Family Line of Shem - Here is the story of Shem’s family line. It was two years after the flood. When Shem was 100 years old, he became the father of Arphaxad.

11.verse: After Arphaxad was born, Shem lived 500 years and had other sons and daughters.

12.verse: When Arphaxad had lived 35 years, he became the father of Shelah.

13.verse: After Shelah was born, Arphaxad lived 403 years and had other sons and daughters.

14.verse: When Shelah had lived 30 years, he became the father of Eber.

15.verse: After Eber was born, Shelah lived 403 years and had other sons and daughters.

16.verse: When Eber had lived 34 years, he became the father of Peleg.

17.verse: After Peleg was born, Eber lived 430 years and had other sons and daughters.

18.verse: When Peleg had lived 30 years, he became the father of Reu.

19.verse: After Reu was born, Peleg lived 209 years and had other sons and daughters.

20.verse: When Reu had lived 32 years, he became the father of Serug.

21.verse: After Serug was born, Reu lived 207 years and had other sons and daughters.

22.verse: When Serug had lived 30 years, he became the father of Nahor.

23.verse: After Nahor was born, Serug lived 200 years and had other sons and daughters.

24.verse: When Nahor had lived 29 years, he became the father of Terah.

25.verse: After Terah was born, Nahor lived 119 years and had other sons and daughters.

26.verse: After Terah was 70 years old, he became the father of Abram, Nahor and Haran.

27.verse: The Family Line of Abram - Here is the story of Terah’s family line. Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor and Haran. And Haran became the father of Lot.

28.verse: Haran died in the city of Ur in Babylonia, the land where he was born. Haran died while his father Terah was still alive.

29.verse: Abram and Nahor both got married. The name of Abram’s wife was Sarai. The name of Nahor’s wife was Milkah, the daughter of Haran. Haran was the father of Milkah and Iscah.

30.verse: But Sarai wasn’t able to have children.

31.verse: Terah left Ur in Babylon. He took with him his son Abram and his grandson Lot, the son of Haran. Terah also took his daughter-in-law Sarai, the wife of his son Abram. All of them left together to go to Canaan. But when they came to Harran, they made their home there.

32.verse: Terah lived for 205 years. And then he died in Harran.

1.verse: God Chooses Abram - The LORD had said to Abram, “Go from your country, your people and your father’s family. Go to the land I will show you.

2.verse: “I will make you into a great nation. And I will bless you. I will make your name great. You will be a blessing to others.

3.verse: I will bless those who bless you. I will put a curse on anyone who puts a curse on you. All nations on earth will be blessed because of you.”

4.verse: So Abram went, just as the LORD had told him. Lot went with him. Abram was 75 years old when he left Harran.

5.verse: He took his wife Sarai and his nephew Lot. They took all the people and possessions they had acquired in Harran. They started out for the land of Canaan. And they arrived there.

6.verse: Abram traveled through the land. He went as far as the large tree of Moreh at Shechem. At that time the Canaanites were living in the land.

7.verse: The LORD appeared to Abram at Shechem. He said, “I will give this land to your family who comes after you.” So Abram built an altar there to honor the LORD, who had appeared to him.

8.verse: From there, Abram went on toward the hills east of Bethel. He set up his tent there. Bethel was to the west, and Ai was to the east. Abram built an altar there and called on the name of the LORD.

9.verse: Then Abram left and continued south toward the Negev Desert.

10.verse: Abram Goes to Egypt - At that time there was not enough food in the land. So Abram went down to Egypt to live there for a while.

11.verse: As he was about to enter Egypt, he spoke to his wife Sarai. He said, “I know what a beautiful woman you are.

12.verse: The people of Egypt will see you and say, ‘This is his wife.’ Then they will kill me. But they will let you live.

13.verse: Tell them you are my sister. Then I’ll be treated well and my life will be spared because of you.”

14.verse: Abram arrived in Egypt. The Egyptians saw that Sarai was a very beautiful woman.

15.verse: When Pharaoh’s officials saw her, they told Pharaoh how beautiful she was. So she was taken into his palace.

16.verse: Pharaoh treated Abram well because of her. So Abram gained more sheep and cattle and male and female donkeys. He also gained more male and female servants and some camels.

17.verse: But the LORD sent terrible sicknesses on Pharaoh and everyone in his palace. The LORD did it because of Abram’s wife Sarai.

18.verse: So Pharaoh sent for Abram. “What have you done to me?” he said. “Why didn’t you tell me she was your wife?

19.verse: Why did you say she was your sister? That’s why I took her to be my wife. Now then, here’s your wife. Take her and go!”

20.verse: Then Pharaoh gave orders to his men about Abram. They sent him on his way. So he left with his wife and everything he had.

1.verse: Abram and Lot Separate - Abram went up from Egypt to the Negev Desert. He took his wife and everything he had. Lot went with him.

2.verse: Abram had become very rich. He had a lot of livestock and silver and gold.

3.verse: Abram left the Negev Desert. He went from place to place until he came to Bethel. Then he came to the place between Bethel and Ai where his tent had been earlier.

4.verse: There he called on the name of the LORD at the altar he had built.

5.verse: Lot was moving around with Abram. Lot also had flocks and herds and tents.

6.verse: But the land didn’t have enough food for both Abram and Lot. They had large herds and many servants, so they weren’t able to stay together.

7.verse: The people who took care of Abram’s herds and those who took care of Lot’s herds began to argue. The Canaanites and Perizzites were also living in the land at that time.

8.verse: So Abram said to Lot, “Let’s not argue with each other. The people taking care of your herds and those taking care of mine shouldn’t argue with one another either. After all, we’re part of the same family.

9.verse: Isn’t the whole land in front of you? Let’s separate. If you go to the left, I’ll go to the right. If you go to the right, I’ll go to the left.”

10.verse: Lot looked around. He saw that the whole Jordan River valley toward the town of Zoar had plenty of water. It was like the garden of the LORD, like the land of Egypt. This was before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah.

11.verse: So Lot chose the whole Jordan River valley for himself. Then he started out toward the east. The two men separated.

12.verse: Abram lived in the land of Canaan. Lot lived among the cities of the Jordan River valley. He set up his tents near Sodom.

13.verse: The people of Sodom were evil. They were sinning greatly against the LORD.

14.verse: The LORD spoke to Abram after Lot had left him. He said, “Look around from where you are. Look north and south, east and west.

15.verse: I will give you all the land you see. I will give it forever to you and your family who comes after you.

16.verse: I will make them like the dust of the earth. Can dust be counted? If it can, then your family can be counted.

17.verse: Go! Walk through the land. See how long and wide it is. I am giving it to you.”

18.verse: So Abram went to live near the large trees of Mamre at Hebron. There he pitched his tents and built an altar to honor the LORD.

1.verse: Abram Saves Lot - Amraphel was the king of Babylon. Arioch was the king of Ellasar. Kedorlaomer was the king of Elam. And Tidal was the king of Goyim.

2.verse: They went to war against five other kings. They were Bera king of Sodom, Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, Shemeber king of Zeboyim, and the king of Bela. Bela was also called Zoar.

3.verse: These five kings all gathered their armies together in the Valley of Siddim. It was also called the valley of the Dead Sea.

4.verse: For 12 years Kedorlaomer had ruled over them. But in the 13th year they opposed him.

5.verse: So in the 14th year, Kedorlaomer and the kings who helped him went to war. They won the battle against the Rephaites in Ashteroth Karnaim. They also won the battle against the Zuzites in Ham and the Emites in Shaveh Kiriathaim.

6.verse: They did the same thing to the Horites in the hill country of Seir. They marched all the way to El Paran near the desert.

7.verse: Then they turned back and went to En Mishpat. En Mishpat was also called Kadesh. They took over the whole territory of the Amalekites. They also won the battle against the Amorites who were living in Hazezon Tamar.

8.verse: Then the kings of Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, Zeboyim and Bela marched out. Bela was also called Zoar. They lined up their armies for battle in the Valley of Siddim.

9.verse: They got ready to fight against Kedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of Goyim, Amraphel king of Babylonia, and Arioch king of Ellasar. There were four kings against five.

10.verse: The Valley of Siddim was full of tar pits. The kings of Sodom and Gomorrah ran away from the battle. Some of their men fell into the pits, but the rest escaped to the hills.

11.verse: The four kings took all the things that belonged to Sodom and Gomorrah. They also took all their food and then left.

12.verse: They carried away Abram’s nephew Lot and the things he owned. Lot was living in Sodom at that time.

13.verse: A man escaped and came to report everything to Abram. Abram was a Hebrew. He was living near the large trees of Mamre the Amorite. Mamre was a brother of Eshkol and Aner. All of them helped Abram.

14.verse: Abram heard that Lot had been captured. So he called out his 318 trained men. All of them were sons of his servants. Abram and his men chased their enemies as far as Dan.

15.verse: During the night Abram separated his men into groups. They attacked their enemies and drove them away. They chased them north of Damascus as far as Hobah.

16.verse: Abram took back everything the kings had taken. He brought back his nephew Lot and the things Lot owned. He also brought back the women and the other people.

17.verse: After Abram won the battle over Kedorlaomer and the kings who helped him, he returned home. The king of Sodom came out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh. It was also called the King’s Valley.

18.verse: Melchizedek was the king of Jerusalem. He brought out bread and wine. He was the priest of the Most High God.

19.verse: He gave a blessing to Abram. He said, “May the Most High God bless Abram. May the Creator of heaven and earth bless him.

20.verse: Give praise to the Most High God. He gave your enemies into your hand.” Then Abram gave Melchizedek a tenth of everything.

21.verse: The king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people. Keep everything else for yourself.”

22.verse: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I have raised my hand to make a promise to the LORD. He is the Most High God. He is the Creator of heaven and earth.

23.verse: I’ve said I will not accept anything that belongs to you. I will not take even a thread or the strap of a sandal. You will never be able to say, ‘I made Abram rich.’

24.verse: I’ll accept only what my men have eaten and what belongs to Aner, Eshkol and Mamre. These three men went with me. Let them have their share.”

1.verse: God Makes a Covenant With Abram - Some time later, Abram had a vision. The LORD said to him, “Abram, do not be afraid. I am like a shield to you. I am your very great reward.”

2.verse: But Abram said, “LORD and King, what can you give me? I still don’t have any children. My servant Eliezer comes from Damascus. When I die, he will get everything I own.”

3.verse: Abram continued, “You haven’t given me any children. So this servant of mine will get everything I own.”

4.verse: Then a message from the LORD came to Abram. The LORD said, “When you die, what you have will not go to this man. You will have a son of your own. He will get everything you have.”

5.verse: The LORD took Abram outside and said, “Look up at the sky. Count the stars, if you can.” Then he said to him, “That’s how many children will be born into your family.”

6.verse: Abram believed the LORD. The LORD was pleased with Abram because he believed. So Abram’s faith made him right with the LORD.

7.verse: He also said to Abram, “I am the LORD. I brought you out of Ur in the land of Babylon. I will give you this land to have as your very own.”

8.verse: But Abram said, “LORD and King, how can I know I will have this land as my own?”

9.verse: So the LORD said to him, “Bring me a young cow, a goat and a ram. Each must be three years old. Bring a dove and a young pigeon along with them.”

10.verse: Abram brought all of them to the LORD. Abram cut them in two and placed the halves opposite each other. But he didn’t cut the birds in half.

11.verse: Then large birds came down to eat the dead bodies of the animals and birds. But Abram chased the large birds away.

12.verse: As the sun was going down, Abram fell into a deep sleep. A thick and scary darkness covered him.

13.verse: Then the LORD said to him, “You can be sure of what I am about to tell you. For 400 years, your family who comes after you will be strangers in another country. They will become slaves there and will be treated badly.

14.verse: But I will punish the nation that makes them slaves. After that, they will leave with many possessions.

15.verse: But you will die in peace. You will join the members of your family who have already died. And you will be buried when you are very old.

16.verse: Your children’s grandchildren will come back here. That’s because the sin of the Amorites has not yet reached the point where I must punish them.”

17.verse: The sun set and it became dark. Then a burning torch and a pot filled with smoking coals appeared. They passed between the pieces of the animals that had been cut in two.

18.verse: On that day the LORD made a covenant with Abram. He said, “I am giving this land to your family who comes after you. It reaches from the River of Egypt to the great Euphrates River.

19.verse: It includes the land of the Kenites, Kenizzites, Kadmonites,

20.verse: Hittites, Perizzites and Rephaites.

21.verse: The Amorites, Canaanites, Girgashites and Jebusites also live there.”

1.verse: Hagar and Ishmael - Abram’s wife Sarai had never had any children by him. But she had a female slave from Egypt named Hagar.

2.verse: So she said to Abram, “The LORD has kept me from having children. Go and sleep with my slave. Maybe I can have a family through her.” Abram agreed to what Sarai had said.

3.verse: His wife Sarai gave him her slave Hagar to be his wife. That was after he had been living in Canaan for ten years.

4.verse: Then he slept with Hagar, and she became pregnant. When Hagar knew she was pregnant, she began to look down on the woman who owned her.

5.verse: Then Sarai said to Abram, “It’s your fault that I’m suffering like this. I put my slave in your arms. Now that she knows she’s pregnant, she looks down on me. May the LORD judge between you and me. May he decide which of us is right.”

6.verse: “Your slave belongs to you,” Abram said. “Do with her what you think is best.” Then Sarai treated Hagar badly. So Hagar ran away from her.

7.verse: The angel of the LORD found Hagar near a spring of water in the desert. The spring was beside the road to Shur.

8.verse: The angel said, “Hagar, you are Sarai’s slave. Where have you come from? Where are you going?” “I’m running away from my owner Sarai,” she answered.

9.verse: Then the angel of the LORD told her, “Go back to the woman who owns you. Obey her.”

10.verse: The angel continued, “I will give you and your family many children. There will be more of them than anyone can count.”

11.verse: The angel of the LORD also said to her, “You are now pregnant and will have a son. You will name him Ishmael, because the LORD has heard about your suffering.

12.verse: He will be like a wild donkey. He will use his power against everyone, and everyone will be against him. He will not get along with any of his family.”

13.verse: She gave a name to the LORD who spoke to her. She called him “You are the God who sees me.” That’s because she said, “I have now seen the One who sees me.”

14.verse: That’s why the well was named Beer Lahai Roi. It’s still there, between Kadesh and Bered.

15.verse: So Hagar had a son by Abram and Abram gave him the name Ishmael.

16.verse: Abram was 86 years old when Hagar had Ishmael by him.

1.verse: The Covenant of Circumcision - When Abram was 99 years old, the LORD appeared to him. He said, “I am the Mighty God. Walk faithfully with me. Live in a way that pleases me.

2.verse: I will now act on my covenant between me and you. I will greatly increase the number of your children after you.”

3.verse: Abram fell with his face to the ground. God said to him,

4.verse: “This is my covenant with you. You will be the father of many nations.

5.verse: You will not be called Abram anymore. Your name will be Abraham, because I have made you a father of many nations.

6.verse: I will greatly increase the number of your children after you. Nations and kings will come from you.

7.verse: I will make my covenant with you last forever. It will be between me and you and your family after you for all time to come. I will be your God. And I will be the God of all your family after you.

8.verse: You are now living in Canaan as an outsider. But I will give you the whole land of Canaan. You will own it forever and so will all your family after you. And I will be their God.”

9.verse: Then God said to Abraham, “You must keep my covenant. You and your family after you must keep it for all time to come.

10.verse: Here is my covenant that you and your family after you must keep. You and every male among you must be circumcised.

11.verse: That will be the sign of the covenant between me and you.

12.verse: It must be done for all time to come. Every male among you who is eight days old must be circumcised. That includes those who are born into your own family or outside it. It also includes those bought with money from a stranger.

13.verse: So any male born into your family or bought with your money must be circumcised. My covenant will last forever. Your body will have the mark of my covenant on it.

14.verse: Any male who has not been circumcised will be separated from his people. He has broken my covenant.”

15.verse: God also said to Abraham, “Do not continue to call your wife by the name Sarai. Her name will be Sarah.

16.verse: I will give her my blessing. You can be sure that I will give you a son by her. I will bless her so that she will be the mother of nations. Kings of nations will come from her.”

17.verse: Abraham fell with his face to the ground. He laughed and said to himself, “Can a 100-year-old man have a son? Can Sarah have a child at the age of 90?”

18.verse: Abraham said to God, “I really wish Ishmael could receive your blessing!”

19.verse: Then God said, “Yes, I will bless Ishmael. But your wife Sarah will have a son by you. And you will name him Isaac. I will establish my covenant with him. That covenant will last forever. It will be for Isaac and his family after him.

20.verse: I have heard what you said about Ishmael. I will surely bless him. I will make his family very large. He will be the father of 12 rulers. And I will make him into a great nation.

21.verse: But I will establish my covenant with Isaac. By this time next year, Sarah will have a son by you.”

22.verse: When God had finished speaking with Abraham, God left him.

23.verse: On that same day Abraham circumcised his son Ishmael. He also circumcised every male who was born into his family or bought with his money. He did exactly as God had told him.

24.verse: Abraham was 99 years old when he was circumcised.

25.verse: His son Ishmael was 13.

26.verse: Abraham and his son Ishmael were both circumcised on that same day.

27.verse: And every male in Abraham’s household was circumcised along with him. That included those born into his family or bought from a stranger.

1.verse: Three Men Visit Abraham - The LORD appeared to Abraham near the large trees of Mamre. Abraham was sitting at the entrance to his tent. It was the hottest time of the day.

2.verse: Abraham looked up and saw three men standing nearby. So he quickly left the entrance to his tent to greet them. He bowed low to the ground.

3.verse: He said, “My lord, if you are pleased with me, don’t pass me by.

4.verse: Let me get you some water. Then all of you can wash your feet and rest under this tree.

5.verse: Let me get you something to eat to give you strength. Then you can go on your way. I want to do this for you now that you have come to me.” “All right,” they answered. “Do as you say.”

6.verse: So Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah. “Quick!” he said. “Get about 36 pounds of the finest flour. Prepare it and bake some bread.”

7.verse: Then he ran over to the herd. He picked out a choice, tender calf. He gave it to a servant, who hurried to prepare it.

8.verse: Then he brought some butter and milk and the calf that had been prepared. He served them to the three men. While they ate, he stood near them under a tree.

9.verse: “Where is your wife Sarah?” they asked him. “Over there in the tent,” he said.

10.verse: Then one of them said, “I will surely return to you about this time next year. Your wife Sarah will have a son.” Sarah was listening at the entrance to the tent, which was behind him.

11.verse: Abraham and Sarah were already very old. Sarah was too old to have a baby.

12.verse: So she laughed to herself. She thought, “I’m worn out, and my husband is old. Can I really know the joy of having a baby?”

13.verse: Then the LORD said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh? Why did she say, ‘Will I really have a baby, now that I am old?’

14.verse: Is anything too hard for me? I will return to you at the appointed time next year. Sarah will have a son.”

15.verse: Sarah was afraid. So she lied and said, “I didn’t laugh.” But the LORD said, “Yes, you laughed.”

16.verse: Abraham Pleads for Sodom - The men got up to leave. They looked down toward Sodom. Abraham walked along with them to see them on their way.

17.verse: Then the LORD said, “Should I hide from Abraham what I am about to do?

18.verse: He will certainly become a great and powerful nation. All nations on earth will be blessed because of him.

19.verse: I have chosen him. He must direct his children to live in the way that pleases me. And he must direct the members of his family after him to do the same. So he must guide all of them in doing what is right and fair. Then I, the LORD, will do for Abraham what I have promised him.”

20.verse: The LORD also said, “The cries against Sodom and Gomorrah are very great. Their sin is so bad

21.verse: that I will go down and see for myself. I want to see if what they have done is as bad as the cries that have reached me. If it is not, then I will know.”

22.verse: The men turned away and went toward Sodom. But Abraham remained standing in front of the LORD.

23.verse: Then Abraham came up to him. He said, “Will you sweep away godly people along with those who are evil?

24.verse: What if there are 50 godly people in the city? Will you really sweep it away? Won’t you spare the place because of the 50 godly people in it?

25.verse: You would never kill godly people along with those who are evil, would you? Would you treat them all alike? You would never do anything like that! Won’t the Judge of the whole earth do what is right?”

26.verse: The LORD said, “If I find 50 godly people in the city of Sodom, I will spare it. I will spare the whole place because of them.”

27.verse: Then Abraham spoke up again. He said, “I have been very bold to speak to the Lord. After all, I’m only dust and ashes.

28.verse: What if the number of godly people is five fewer than 50? Will you destroy the whole city because there are five fewer people?” “If I find 45 there,” he said, “I will not destroy it.”

29.verse: Once again Abraham spoke to him. He asked, “What if only 40 are found there?” He said, “If there are 40, I will not do it.”

30.verse: Then Abraham said, “Lord, please don’t be angry with me. Let me speak. What if only 30 can be found there?” He answered, “If I find 30, I will not do it.”

31.verse: Abraham said, “I have been very bold to speak to the Lord. What if only 20 can be found there?” He said, “If I find 20, I will not destroy it.”

32.verse: Then he said, “Lord, please don’t be angry with me. Let me speak just one more time. What if only ten can be found there?” He answered, “If I find ten, I will not destroy it.”

33.verse: When the LORD had finished speaking with Abraham, he left. And Abraham returned home.

1.verse: The LORD Destroys Sodom and Gomorrah - The two angels arrived at Sodom in the evening. Lot was sitting near the gate of the city. When Lot saw the angels, he got up to greet them. He bowed down with his face to the ground.

2.verse: “My lords,” he said, “please come to my house. You can wash your feet and spend the night there. Then you can go on your way early in the morning.” “No,” they answered. “We’ll spend the night in the town square.”

3.verse: But Lot wouldn’t give up. So they went with him and entered his house. He prepared a meal for them. He baked bread without using yeast. And they ate.

4.verse: Before Lot and his guests had gone to bed, all the men came from every part of the city of Sodom. Young and old men alike surrounded the house.

5.verse: They called out to Lot. They said, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us. We want to have sex with them.”

6.verse: Lot went outside to meet them. He shut the door behind him.

7.verse: He said, “No, my friends. Don’t do such an evil thing.

8.verse: Look, I have two daughters that no man has ever slept with. I’ll bring them out to you now. Then do to them what you want to. But don’t do anything to these men. I’ve brought them inside so they can be safe.”

9.verse: “Get out of our way!” the men of Sodom replied to Lot. “You came here as an outsider. Now you want to act like a judge! We’ll treat you worse than them.” They kept trying to force Lot to open the door. Then they moved forward to break it down.

10.verse: But the the angels inside reached out and pulled Lot back into the house and shut the door.

11.verse: Then they made the men who were at the door of the house blind. They blinded both young and old men so that they couldn’t find the door.

12.verse: The two angels said to Lot, “Do you have any other family members here? Do you have sons-in-law, sons, daughters or any other relatives in the city? Get them out of here!

13.verse: We are going to destroy this place. Many have cried out to the LORD against the people of this city. So he has sent us to destroy it.”

14.verse: Then Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law. They had promised to marry his daughters. He said, “Hurry up! Get out of this place! The LORD is about to destroy the city!” But his sons-in-law thought he was joking.

15.verse: The sun was coming up. So the angels tried to get Lot to leave. They said, “Hurry up! Take your wife and your two daughters who are here. Get out! If you don’t, you will be swept away when the city is destroyed.”

16.verse: Lot didn’t move right away. So the men grabbed him by the hand. They also took hold of the hands of his wife and two daughters. They led all of them safely out of the city. The LORD had mercy on them.

17.verse: As soon as the angels had brought them out, one of them spoke. He said, “Run for your lives! Don’t look back! Don’t stop anywhere in the valley! Run to the mountains! If you don’t, you will be swept away!”

18.verse: But Lot said to them, “No, my lords! Please!

19.verse: You have done me a big favor. You have been very kind to me by sparing my life. But I can’t run to the mountains. I won’t be able to escape this horrible thing that’s going to happen. And then I’ll die.

20.verse: Look, here’s a town near enough to run to. It’s small. Let me run to it. It’s very small, isn’t it? Then my life will be spared.”

21.verse: The LORD said to Lot, “All right. I will also give you what you are asking for. I will not destroy the town you are talking about.

22.verse: But run there quickly. I can’t do anything until you reach it.” The town was named Zoar. Zoar means Small.

23.verse: By the time Lot reached Zoar, the sun had risen over the land.

24.verse: Then the LORD sent down burning sulfur. It came down like rain on Sodom and Gomorrah. It came from the LORD. It came out of the sky.

25.verse: The LORD destroyed these cities and the whole valley. All the people who were living in the cities were wiped out. So were the plants in the land.

26.verse: But Lot’s wife looked back. When she did, she became a pillar made out of salt.

27.verse: Early the next morning Abraham got up. He returned to the place where he had stood in front of the LORD.

28.verse: He looked down toward Sodom and Gomorrah and the whole valley. He saw thick smoke rising from the land. It looked like smoke from a furnace.

29.verse: So when God destroyed the cities of the valley, he showed concern for Abraham. He brought Lot out safely when he destroyed the cities where Lot had lived.

30.verse: Lot and His Daughters - Lot and his two daughters left Zoar. They went to live in the mountains because Lot was afraid to stay in Zoar. So he and his daughters lived in a cave.

31.verse: One day the older daughter spoke to the younger one. She said, “Our father is old. People all over the earth have men to marry and have children with. We do not.

32.verse: So let’s get our father to drink wine. Then we can sleep with him. We can use our father to continue our family line.”

33.verse: That night they got their father to drink wine. Then the older daughter went in and slept with him. He wasn’t aware when she lay down or when she got up.

34.verse: The next day the older daughter spoke to the younger one again. She said, “Last night I slept with my father. Let’s get him to drink wine again tonight. Then you go in and sleep with him. We can use our father to continue our family line.”

35.verse: So they got their father to drink wine that night also. Then the younger daughter slept with him. Again he wasn’t aware when she lay down or when she got up.

36.verse: So both of Lot’s daughters became pregnant by their father.

37.verse: The older daughter had a son. She named him Moab. He’s the father of the Moabites of today.

38.verse: The younger daughter also had a son. She named him Ben-Ammi. He’s the father of the Ammonites of today.

1.verse: Abraham and Abimelek - Abraham moved south into the Negev Desert. He lived between Kadesh and Shur. For a while he stayed in Gerar.

2.verse: There Abraham said about his wife Sarah, “She’s my sister.” Then Abimelek, the king of Gerar, sent for Sarah and took her.

3.verse: So God appeared to Abimelek in a dream one night. He said to him, “You are as good as dead because of the woman you have taken. She is already married.”

4.verse: But Abimelek hadn’t gone near her. So he said, “Lord, will you destroy a nation that hasn’t done anything wrong?

5.verse: Didn’t Abraham say to me, ‘She’s my sister’? And didn’t she also say, ‘He’s my brother’? I had no idea I was doing anything wrong.”

6.verse: Then God spoke to him in the dream. He said, “Yes, I know you had no idea you were doing anything wrong. So I have kept you from sinning against me. That is why I did not let you touch her.

7.verse: Now return the man’s wife to him. He is a prophet. So he will pray for you, and you will live. But what if you do not return her? Then you can be sure that you and all your people will die.”

8.verse: Early the next morning Abimelek sent for all his officials. When he told them everything that had happened, they were really afraid.

9.verse: Then Abimelek called Abraham in. Abimelek said, “What have you done to us? Have I done something wrong to you? Why have you brought so much guilt on me and my kingdom? You have done things to me that should never be done.”

10.verse: Abimelek also asked Abraham, “Why did you do this?”

11.verse: Abraham replied, “I thought, ‘There is no respect for God in this place. They will kill me because of my wife.’

12.verse: Besides, she really is my sister. She’s the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother. And she became my wife.

13.verse: God had me wander away from my father’s house. So I said to her, ‘Here is how you can show your love to me. Everywhere we go, say about me, “He’s my brother.” ’ ”

14.verse: Then Abimelek gave Abraham sheep and cattle and male and female slaves. He also returned his wife Sarah to him.

15.verse: Abimelek said, “Here is my land. Live anywhere you want to.”

16.verse: He said to Sarah, “I’m giving your brother 25 pounds of silver. This will show everyone with you that I am sorry for what I did to you. You haven’t done anything wrong.”

17.verse: Then Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelek. He also healed his wife and his female slaves so they could have children again.

18.verse: The LORD had kept all the women in Abimelek’s house from having children. He had done it because of Abraham’s wife Sarah.

1.verse: Isaac Is Born - The LORD was gracious to Sarah, just as he had said he would be. The LORD did for Sarah what he had promised to do.

2.verse: Sarah became pregnant. She had a son by Abraham when he was old. The child was born at the exact time God had promised.

3.verse: Abraham gave the name Isaac to the son Sarah had by him.

4.verse: When his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him. He did it exactly as God had commanded him.

5.verse: Abraham was 100 years old when his son Isaac was born to him.

6.verse: Sarah said, “God has given laughter to me. Everyone who hears about this will laugh with me.”

7.verse: She also said, “Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would breast-feed children? But I’ve had a son by him when he is old.”

8.verse: Abraham Sends Hagar and Ishmael Away - Isaac grew. The time came for his mother to stop breast-feeding him. On that day Abraham prepared a big celebration.

9.verse: But Sarah saw Ishmael making fun of Isaac. Ishmael was the son Hagar had by Abraham. Hagar was Sarah’s Egyptian slave.

10.verse: Sarah said to Abraham, “Get rid of that slave woman! Get rid of her son! That woman’s son will never have a share of the family’s property. All of it belongs to my son Isaac.”

11.verse: What Sarah said upset Abraham very much. After all, Ishmael was his son.

12.verse: But God said to Abraham, “Do not be so upset about the boy and your slave Hagar. Listen to what Sarah tells you, because your family line will continue through Isaac.

13.verse: I will also make the son of your slave into a nation. I will do it because he is your child.”

14.verse: Early the next morning Abraham got some food and a bottle of water. The bottle was made out of animal skin. He gave the food and water to Hagar, placing them on her shoulders. Then he sent her away with the boy. She went on her way and wandered in the Desert of Beersheba.

15.verse: When the water in the bottle was gone, she put the boy under a bush.

16.verse: Then she sat down about as far away as a person can shoot an arrow. She thought, “I can’t stand to watch the boy die.” As she sat there, she began to sob.

17.verse: God heard the boy crying. Then the angel of God called out to Hagar from heaven. He said to her, “What is the matter, Hagar? Do not be afraid. God has heard the boy crying as he lies there.

18.verse: Lift up the boy and take him by the hand. I will make him into a great nation.”

19.verse: Then God opened Hagar’s eyes, and she saw a well of water. So she went and filled the bottle with water and gave the boy a drink.

20.verse: God was with the boy as he grew up. He lived in the desert and learned to shoot a bow and arrow.

21.verse: While he was living in the Desert of Paran, his mother got a wife for him from Egypt.

22.verse: The Agreement at Beersheba - At that time Abimelek and his army commander, Phicol, spoke to Abraham. They said to Abraham, “God is with you in everything you do.

23.verse: Now make a promise to me here while God is watching. Give me your word that you will treat me fairly. Promise that you will treat my children and their children the same way. I’ve been kind to you. Now you be kind to me and the country where you are living as an outsider.”

24.verse: Abraham said, “I give you my word that I’ll do it.”

25.verse: Then Abraham complained to Abimelek that his servants had taken over a well of water.

26.verse: But Abimelek said, “I don’t know who has done this. You didn’t tell me. And today is the first time I heard about it.”

27.verse: So Abraham gave Abimelek sheep and cattle. The two men came to an agreement.

28.verse: Then Abraham picked out seven female lambs from his flock.

29.verse: Abimelek asked Abraham, “What’s the meaning of these seven female lambs? Why have you picked them out and set them apart?”

30.verse: Abraham replied, “Accept the seven lambs from me. They will be a witness that I dug this well.”

31.verse: So that place was named Beersheba. That’s because there the two men came to an agreement.

32.verse: After the agreement had been made at Beersheba, Abimelek went back to the land of the Philistines. His army commander, Phicol, went with him.

33.verse: Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba. There he called on the name of the LORD, the God who lives forever.

34.verse: Abraham stayed in the land of the Philistines for a long time.

1.verse: God Tests Abraham - Some time later God tested Abraham. He said to him, “Abraham!” “Here I am,” Abraham replied.

2.verse: Then God said, “Take your son, your only son. He is the one you love. Take Isaac. Go to the place called Moriah. Give your son to me there as a burnt offering. Sacrifice him on the mountain I will show you.”

3.verse: Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took two of his servants and his son Isaac with him. He cut enough wood for the burnt offering. Then he started out for the place God had shown him.

4.verse: On the third day Abraham saw the place a long way off.

5.verse: He said to his servants, “Stay here with the donkey. I and the boy will go over there and worship. Then we’ll come back to you.”

6.verse: Abraham had his son Isaac carry the wood for the burnt offering. He himself carried the fire and the knife. And the two of them walked on together.

7.verse: Then Isaac said to his father Abraham, “Father?” “Yes, my son?” Abraham replied. “The fire and wood are here,” Isaac said. “But where is the lamb for the burnt offering?”

8.verse: Abraham answered, “God himself will provide the lamb for the burnt offering, my son.” And the two of them walked on together.

9.verse: They reached the place God had shown Abraham. There Abraham built an altar. He arranged the wood on it. He tied up his son Isaac. Abraham placed him on the altar, on top of the wood.

10.verse: Then he reached out his hand. He picked up the knife to kill his son.

11.verse: But the angel of the LORD called out to him from heaven. He said, “Abraham! Abraham!” “Here I am,” Abraham replied.

12.verse: “Do not lay a hand on the boy,” he said. “Do not harm him. Now I know that you would do anything for God. You have not held back from me your son, your only son.”

13.verse: Abraham looked around. There in a bush he saw a ram caught by its horns. He went over and took the ram. He sacrificed it as a burnt offering instead of his son.

14.verse: So Abraham named that place The LORD Will Provide. To this day people say, “It will be provided on the mountain of the LORD.”

15.verse: The angel of the LORD called out to Abraham from heaven a second time.

16.verse: He said, “I am giving you my word that I will bless you. I will bless you because of what you have done,” announces the LORD. “You have not held back your son, your only son.

17.verse: So I will certainly bless you. I will make the children born into your family as many as the stars in the sky. I will make them as many as the grains of sand on the seashore. They will take over the cities of their enemies.

18.verse: All nations on earth will be blessed because of your children. All these things will happen because you have obeyed me.”

19.verse: Then Abraham returned to his servants. They started out together for Beersheba. And Abraham stayed in Beersheba.

20.verse: Nahor’s Sons - Some time later Abraham was told, “Milkah has become a mother. She has had sons by your brother Nahor.

21.verse: Uz was born first. Then came his brother Buz. Kemuel was born next. He became the father of Aram.

22.verse: Milkah’s other sons are Kesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph and Bethuel.”

23.verse: Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. Milkah had the eight sons by Abraham’s brother Nahor.

24.verse: Nahor had a concubine named Reumah. She also had sons. They were Tebah, Gaham, Tahash and Maakah.

1.verse: Sarah Dies - Sarah lived to be 127 years old.

2.verse: She died at Kiriath Arba. Kiriath Arba is also called Hebron. It’s in the land of Canaan. Sarah’s death made Abraham very sad. He went to the place where her body was lying. There he wept over her.

3.verse: Then Abraham got up from beside his wife’s body. He said to the Hittites,

4.verse: “I’m an outsider. I’m a stranger among you. Sell me some property where I can bury those in my family who die. Then I can bury my wife.”

5.verse: The Hittites replied to Abraham,

6.verse: “Sir, listen to us. You are a mighty prince among us. Bury your wife in the best place we have to bury our dead. None of us will refuse to sell you a place to bury her.”

7.verse: Then Abraham bowed down in front of the Hittites, the people of the land.

8.verse: He said to them, “If you are willing to let me bury my wife, then listen to me. Speak to Zohar’s son Ephron for me.

9.verse: Ask him to sell me the cave of Machpelah. It belongs to him and is at the end of his field. Ask him to sell it to me for the full price. I want it as a place to bury my dead wife among you.”

10.verse: Ephron the Hittite was sitting there among his people. He replied to Abraham. All of the Hittites who had come to the gate of his city heard him.

11.verse: “No, sir,” Ephron said. “Listen to me. I will give you the field. I’ll also give you the cave that’s in the field. I will give it to you in front of my people. Bury your wife.”

12.verse: Again Abraham bowed down in front of the people of the land.

13.verse: He spoke to Ephron so they could hear him. He said, “Please listen to me. I’ll pay the price of the field. Accept it from me. Then I can bury my wife there.”

14.verse: Ephron answered Abraham,

15.verse: “Sir, listen to me. The land is worth ten pounds of silver. But what’s that between the two of us? Bury your wife.”

16.verse: Abraham agreed to Ephron’s offer. He weighed out for Ephron the price he had named. The Hittites there had heard the amount. The price was ten pounds of silver. Abraham measured it by the weights that were used by merchants.

17.verse: So Ephron sold his field to Abraham. The field was in Machpelah near Mamre. Abraham bought the field and the cave that was in it. He also bought all the trees that were inside the borders of the field. Everything was sold

18.verse: to Abraham as his property. He bought it in front of all the Hittites who had come to the gate of the city.
